stories.text:
Last year we cleared $11 million in ARR¹ with almost 100% inbound sales (while bootstrapped).

Some customers have taken us into > 9 different gigs.

We are considering a Tesla style referral reward program (use this code, rewards accrue) to say thanks, but don’t want to accidentally cheapen a previously honest, organic thing.

Any thoughts?

__ ¹ https://blog.thinkst.com/2021/03/we-bootstrapped-to-11-million-in-arr.html
stories.title: Ask HN: Will referral codes cheapen honest referrals?

stories.text: I went a couple time in early 2000's and loved it. I started to sour on it when a massive amount of oil was lit on fire for an art installation a little later. Now it's limping along in the pandemic, but the organizers still want to set large fires in times of climate crisis. I don't care if they do carbon offsets, it's still not a good look. The symbolism has changed. Why not do a light show? But no, they want to be "buring" man. I think the festival won't be able to come back from the pandemic and the increasingly severe climate crisis. The participants will look more and more out of touch.
